p: Dimethyl sulfide (DMS), a major compound of the P. padina headspace, results from an enzymatic decomposition of dimethyl-Î²-propiothetin [ 33], a metabolite of methionine that is fairly widespread in marine plants. Formed dimethylsulfoniopropionate (DMSP), a tertiary sulfonium compound, is the precursor of DMS. Recently, the algal enzyme responsible for the formation of DMS from DMSP was found and characterised in alga Emiliania huxleyi [ 39].
